intro: Galium ruricola, commonly known as field bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Galium ruricola typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows.
